parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Known, an acquaintance. From ginosko; well-known.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
(a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A place, piece of land, field, property, estate. Diminutive of chora; a spot or plot of ground.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Language, speech, conversation, manner of speaking. From dialegomai; a discourse, i.e. 'dialect'.
Akeldama (in Aramaic: field of blood). Of Chaldee origin; Akeldama, a place near Jerusalem.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A place, piece of land, field, property, estate. Diminutive of chora; a spot or plot of ground.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
